FuncDef:
The whitelist session-car dhcpv6-server command sets values for the DHCPv6 session CAR parameters.
The undo whitelist session-car dhcpv6-server command restores the default values for the DHCPv6 session CAR parameters.
By default, the CIR, CBS, PIR, and PBS of DHCP session CAR are 256 kbit/s, 32000 bytes, 512 kbit/s, and 64000 bytes, respectively.
CLIs: whitelist session-car dhcpv6-server { cir <cir-value> | cbs <cbs-value> | pir <pir-value> | pbs <pbs-value> } *
undo whitelist session-car dhcpv6-server [ cir <cir-value> | cbs <cbs-value> | pir <pir-value> | pbs <pbs-value> ] *

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the committed information rate (CIR).
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1000000, in kbit/s.

Specifies the committed burst size (CBS).
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9000000, in bytes.

Specifies the peak information rate (PIR).
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1000000, in kbit/s.
pir-value must be greater than or equal to cir-value.

Specifies the peak burst size (PBS).
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9000000, in bytes.
pbs-value must be greater than or equal to cbs-value.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the configured DHCPv6 session CAR parameters do not meet service bandwidth requirements, you can run the whitelist session-car dhcpv6-server command to modify the bandwidth values as needed.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
